Cost / Budget Analyst Job at May & Baker Nigeria Plc




        
    

        
        May & Baker Nigeria Plc was founded on September 4, 1944 as Nigeria's first pharmaceutical company. It has its origin in England, the United Kingdom in 1834 where three chemists founded Grimwade, May & Pickett, a firm for manufacturing chemicals for pharmaceutical products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cost / Budget Analyst

Job Location: Nigeria
Working Hours: Full Time

Qualifications
     

            
    




	The incumbent must possess a minimum of HND/B.Sc in Accountancy or related field, be partly ICAN qualified with a minimum of four years of cognate experience in Factory Accounting / Costing and Budgets.
	The preferred candidate must possess good numerical and analytical skills in addition to excellent communication skills.
	Candidates must be computer literate with working knowledge of relevant ERP, self-disciplined, methodical and thorough in approach with ability to work cordially within a team to achieve results.


Benefits
Attractive and negotiable.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@may-baker.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Business Development & Sales Manager Job at Nestoil Plc




        
    

        
        Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil & gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development & Sales Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking to hire an experienced Business Development & Sales Manager to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, responsible for identifying and developing new business opportunities for the Obijackson Group of Companies as well as managing the relationship with current clients


Responibilities
As a Business Development & Sales Manager, you will be responsible for:


	Engaging assigned clients (NOC, IOC’s and independents) to ensure continuous visibility and participation of assigned SBU in all applicable market segments
	Overseeing the prospecting and developing new business including cold calling, scheduling client introductions, meetings and engagements, preparing and delivering presentations, documentation, proposals and bids to win new business.
	Supervising the development of sales proposals, estimates, specifications and presentations.
	Participating in trade shows, exhibitions, technology, product and service exhibitions & demonstrations, promoting company image and offerings.
	Ensuring that the SBU meets all contract terms and conditions and that all benefits derivable from each contract are fully enjoyed.
	Developing and maintaining long-term relationships with clients and key government and regulatory agencies and representatives.
	Monitoring and reporting on competitor performance and market trends and threats.
	Ensuing strict adherence to QHSE policies and procedures and complying with safe work methods as required. 
	Performing any other duty that may be assigned by Line Manager


Requirements
What are we looking for?


	Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Business or related field 
	Minimum of 5 years of significant experience in Business Development of Engineered solutions in the Marine/Maritime Industry.
	Any related Professional Qualification is required.
	Knowledge of tendering procedures in the in the Marine & Maritime Industry
	Strong project management skills
	Good leadership and team building skills
	Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks
	Good numeric, Analytical and Presentation skills 
	Good written and Oral communication skills
	Extensive experience of working closely with Legal, Proposals and Business development functions from a pre-contract perspective
	Ability to establish strong interpersonal relationships and successful network
	Ability to travel at short notice
	Initiative and problem-solving skills
	Highly motivated and the ability to work under tight deadlines
	Team player with excellent personnel management skills.
	Proficient in Corel Draw, Photoshop, Photo Paint, MS Office tools etc

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Full Stack Engineer",
  "description": "Dovichi Worldwide Technology Company Limited is a digital technology company delivering innovative edtech products, solutions, and services. We cater to both business and consumer markets with a diverse portfolio that includes SaaS-based solutions, alongside digital products tailored for individuals and businesses. With over six years of focused experience in the African edtech industry.

Our team brings together more than 20 years of global experience across multiple industries, including telecommunications, education, the legal sector, research, media, and technology. This wealth of expertise enables us to deliver comprehensive, innovative solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. With years of focused experience in the African edtech industry, our clients span a range of industries, reflecting our ability to deliver tailored digital solutions that meet diverse business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Remote
Employment Type: Full-time
Start Date: Immediate

Role Description


	We are seeking a technically strong and product-driven Full Stack Engineerwith can-do attitude and is able take full ownership of the development lifecycle &mdash; from development through deployment &mdash; and lead our platform to a functional and scalable MVP.
	In this role, you won&rsquo;t just write code &mdash; you&rsquo;ll engineer the entire product stack, drive architectural decisions, and play a pivotal role in transforming concepts into high-performing, production-ready software.
	You must be comfortable working across both front-end and back-end technologies, integrating AI services, and deploying maintainable, scalable systems. You will be expected to set up and lead all core engineering operations, manage deployments, and ensure performance, security, and usability standards are met.

title: Job Vacancies at Clearer Group
content:
Clearer Group, We are an Innovative Technology company that simplifies and powers cross border payments and digital financial solutions for individuals and businesses across emerging and dveloped market, Our goal is to bridge the gap in global financial acess by offering faster, cheaper, and more transparent payment services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Trade Service Manager

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a strategic, visionary, and execution-driven Trade service managerto lead and scale our international trade and export solutions.
	This role is pivotal to our growth strategy, with direct responsibility for developing products, partnerships, and operational frameworks that enable Nigerian and African businesses to trade globally — faster, more securely, and with fewer barriers.
	You will own the end-to-end development of our export trade services, including trade finance, documentation facilitation, compliance, and customer onboarding, while collaborating with regulators, banks, logistics partners, and internal product teams.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement the global trade and export strategy in alignment with Clearer’s cross-border settlement goals.
	Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to design and launch trade/export products (e.g., trade finance, export documentation platforms, FX hedging tools).
	Build and maintain relationships with local and international trade bodies, banks, freight and customs partners, export councils, and regulatory agencies.
	Lead a team to advise clients (exporters, manufacturers, SMEs) on compliance, international market access, export readiness, and funding.
	Oversee trade documentation processes, ensure alignment with international trade regulations (AfCFTA, INCOTERMS, etc.), and manage associated risks.
	Identify trade opportunities across West Africa and other emerging markets; work on expanding Clearer’s service coverage regionally and globally.
	Represent Clearer at trade forums, summits, and regulatory roundtables.
	Develop white papers, policy briefs, and export guides in collaboration with marketing.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in International Trade, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or related field (Master’s degree is a plus).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in international trade, export finance, or cross-border payments, preferably in fintech, banking, or trade facilitation bodies.
	Proven expertise in trade/export operations, trade finance instruments (LCs, guarantees), and international compliance standards.
	Strong network within trade ecosystem: NEPC, NEXIM Bank, Customs, shipping lines, ECOWAS trade groups, and relevant ministries.
	Deep understanding of *cross-border settlement*, FX regulation, and payment infrastructure in Nigeria and across Africa.
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and communication skills.


Salary
N700,000 - N1,000,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 15th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@clearer.eu using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

3.) Senior Product Manager

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Decscription


	As a Product Manager, you will own the lifecycle of key products and features, working closely with engineering (C#/ASP.NET, React Native, JavaScript, Next.js), design, compliance, and commercial teams.
	You will be responsible for translating business needs into scalable product solutions, ensuring alignment with user needs, regulatory requirements, and company objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead end-to-end product development: ideation, planning, execution, and roll out.
	Collaborate with backend and frontend developers to ensure features are feasible, technically sound, and delivered on time.
	Translate complex business requirements into clear, actionable product specifcations and user stories.
	Create and manage product roadmaps, backlogs, and sprint plans.
	Coordinate cross-functional teams across engineering, compliance, operations, and sales to deliver seamless user experiences.
	Prioritize features and tasks based on business impact, customer needs, and technical constraints.
	Analyze user behavior, feedback, and product performance to drive continuous improvement.
	Work closely with QA and DevOps to ensure high-quality, bug-free releases.
	Monitor product metrics, usage, and adoption, and report on KPIs to
	stakeholders.
	Stay informed on industry trends, competitor products, and compliance requirements.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 9 - 15 years of work experience.


Salary
N800,000 - N1,000,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 5th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cv to: gift@clearer.eu using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Chief Technology Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	Lead the technology team, developing and implementing a technology vision and roadmap aligned with Clearer business objectives.
	Oversee the design, development, and deployment of secure, scalable, and highperformance full-stack systems using C# ASP.NET and React.
	Stay informed about the latest technology trends and advancements, evaluating their potential impact on Clearer and recommending appropriate technologies.
	Lead the development and maintenance of user interfaces using React and related technologies, ensuring a seamless user experience for our financial applications.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree
	7+ years of progressive experience in software development, with a significant focus on full-stack development and fintech applications.
	3+ years of experience in a technology leadership role, demonstrating the ability to lead teams and manage projects effectively.
	Strong proficiency in: Backend technologies C# ASP.NET and SQL Server and Frontend dReact and related technologies (JSX, Webpack).
	Solid experience with Azure cloud services and infrastructure management. Proven experience working in the fintech industry, demonstrating a strong understanding of financial systems, regulations, and security requirements (compulsory).
	Experience with API development, integration, and security protocols. Strong leadership, communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.


Salary
N700,000 - N1,000,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 5th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: gift@clearer.eu using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
